meanings.definition: A member of a gang of robbers in India.
meanings.sent1: The dakoits planned their next heist under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent2: The villagers lived in fear of the dakoits who roamed the countryside.
meanings.sent3: The dakoits tried to steal the chickens, but they clucked loudly, alerting the farmers.
meanings.sent4: The dakoits were like shadows in the night, striking swiftly and silently.
meanings.sent5: The image of the dakoits on horseback, wearing masks, was etched in the villagers' minds.

meanings.sent1: He decided to dakoit with the gang to earn some quick money.
meanings.sent2: She warned her brother not to dakoit as it was illegal and dangerous.
meanings.sent3: The children played a game pretending to dakoit, chasing each other around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The politician was accused of trying to dakoit the public funds for personal gain.
meanings.sent5: The actor had to dakoit convincingly in the movie, portraying a notorious thief.
